page.title: 12NETHER WHITACRE SCHOOL
page.content: The Nether Whitacre School log books show the changes in educational ideas throughout this century. The school was given to the village by Charles Jennens, friend of the composer Handel. The building now used was originally a house with a classroom at each end. It has undergone many changes & at present caters for children from 5 to 11 years of age. In 1979 it was threatened with closure but this was overruled. It was again scheduled to close in 1985 but parental action opposing the move lead to a change of proposal; that of re_ organising to a first school(5_8). The Minister of State for Education rejected this proposal and the school remains at the moment as a 5_11 school but with a very unstable future.
